column4: can anyone tell me what this means?:  http://pastebin.com/d60953f6e
first ubuntu uses ash as default sh and not bash. second: you do not have kernel-headers instaled
so what do I do to fix it?
for the first error jus use the work araoun proposed and use 'make SHELL=/bin/bash'
for the second error 'sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r)'
if you are building a driver you will need build-essential too
the $ being my kernel and I leave the (uname -r)?
sorry.  It says both are all ready the newest version?
just copy paste ( $(uname -r) gets evaluated by the shell)
well then you are ready to go use the modified make command
I still get the same error though.
with 'make SHELL=/bin/bash' ?
http://pastebin.com/d54185984
are you sure you run this 'sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r)' as is ?
I have no /source but there is a Makefile in .../build
yes.  both packages said they were the latest version
the i dunno what's going wrong...
i checked the intel site... dis you installed the new mac80211 subsystem first?
yes and I checked that it was running
I ran modprobe mac80211 and didn't get any errors, and it was listed in lsmod
well you will have to ask in their support forums or mailing list
in linux is /etc/init.d/ for suystem wide scripts... or simply add a call to your script from /etc/rc.local
if you want to run it when you log in.. System>Preferences>init apps
